{{Infobox station | name = SarÄ±kamÄ±Å | type = [[Turkish State Railways|TCDD]] | style = | image = | image_size = 300 | image_caption = | address = Kars-SarÄ±kamÄ±Å Yolu, SarÄ±kamÄ±Å, Turkey | coordinates = {{Coord|40.200857|42.343596|type:railwaystation_region:TR|display=inline,title}} | line = [[Eastern Express]] | other = | structure = At-grade | platform = 2 | depth = | levels = | tracks = 4 | parking = | bicycle = | baggage_check = | opened = 1913 | closed = | rebuilt = 1962 | electrified = | ADA = | code = 4636 | owned = [[Turkish State Railways|TCDD]] | zone = | status = In Operation | former = | passengers = | pass_year = | pass_percent = | pass_system = | mpassengers = | services = | map_locator = }} The '''SarÄ±kamÄ±Å Railway Station''' is a railway station in the town of [[SarÄ±kamÄ±Å]], [[Turkey]]. The station is serviced by the [[Eastern Express]], operated by the [[Turkish State Railways]], running between [[Istanbul]] and [[Kars]].[http://www.tcdd.gov.tr/home/detail/?id=495 TCDD Timetables] - Eastern Express timetable, August 20, 2010 The station was built in 1913 with [[broad gauge]] tracks by the [[Russian Empire]]. The tracks were converted into [[standard gauge]] in 1962. ==Service==
